newsitem.title: USA: American Home pain medication gets FDA ok.
newsitem.headline: American Home pain medication gets FDA ok.

text.p: Wyeth-Ayerst Laboratories said Wednesday that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration had cleared Duract, a nonnarcotic analgesic, for marketing.

Wyeth-Ayerst, a division of American Home Products Corp, said the drug belongs to the nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug class and provides relief without the potential for the side effects that can accompany narcotic opioid analgesics.
Lethargy and sleepiness are some of the side effects of narcotic opioid analgesics, said Wyeth-Ayerst spokesman Douglas Petkus.
Petkus said the drug is indicated for short-term use, generally less than 10 days.
Wyeth-Ayerst said clinical studies demonstrated Duract effective in a range of applications, including following abdominal, gynecologic, oral or orthopedic surgery.

The most frequent complaints with Duract use involve minor gastrointestinal problems, the company said. In some instances serious gastrointestinal toxicity such as perforation, ulceration and bleeding can occur, the company said.
